cyclone.name: KAREN
cyclone.current_location: about 290 miles south-southeast of St. Croix
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the eastern Caribbean, forecast to turn north on Tuesday and pass over or very near Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, then continue northward into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or over the U.S. Virgin Islands/Puerto Rico (including St. Croix)

weather_observation.warning_coast: U.S. Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico (including Vieques and Culebra)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern Caribbean from the Lesser Antilles northward through the Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40 mph with higher gusts) possible Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday night
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy showers with 2–4 inches, isolated 6 inches; risk of flash flooding and mudslides
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents around the port approaches
